snippet: Max Schrems's crusade against the information collected by the social network has become a cause célèbre in parts of Europe, looming over the company as it prepares to go public.
abstract: Max Schrems's crusade against the information collected by the social network has become a cause célèbre in parts of Europe, looming over the company as it prepares to go public.
lead_paragraph: Max Schrems, a 24-year-old college student and a user of Facebook since 2008, has led a vocal campaign in Europe against what he maintains are Facebook's illegal practices of collecting and marketing users' personal data, reports Kevin J. O'Brien, for The New York Times. Mr. Schrems and his crusade has attracted the attention of lawmakers in Brussels as the Continent begins a lengthy debate over tough new proposed restrictions on personal data, which could affect Web businesses like Facebook.Read more »

headline.main: An Austrian Law Student Faces Down Facebook
